intro: Agaloma ipecacuanhae, commonly known as the Brazilian ipecacuanha, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that turn red when mature, containing seeds surrounded by a fleshy pulp. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in humid forests and shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated for both aesthetic and medicinal purposes.
